snippet: Heineken claimed victory in its fight to gain control of Asia Pacific Breweries on Friday, announcing a sweetened deal to buy the rights to the beer maker held by Fraser & Neave for about $4.5 billion.
abstract: Heineken claimed victory in its fight to gain control of Asia Pacific Breweries on Friday, announcing a sweetened deal to buy the rights to the beer maker held by Fraser & Neave for about $4.5 billion.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

headline.main: Heineken Clinches Deal for Asia Pacific Breweries With $4.5 Billion Offer
